title: Death toll rises to 13 in Elephanta ferry crash; 101 passengers rescued: CM Fadnavis - mid-day.com
Man Rapes 10-Year-Old Girl, Inserts Rod In Her Genitals: Gujarat Police - NDTV
summary:
Man Arrested for Raping and Injuring 10-Year-Old Girl in Gujarat: Police

Date & Source: NDTV, December 18, 2024

Introduction: A 10-year-old girl was kidnapped and raped by a 36-year-old man in Gujarat's Bharuch. The accused, identified as Vijay Paswan, was arrested by the police.

  • The incident took place in the Jhagadia industrial area of Bharuch on Monday.
  • The accused lived next to the girl's hut and worked in the same factory as her father.
  • The girl sustained injuries to her private parts and was taken to a civil hospital in Bharuch but her condition worsened due to an injury in the waist and she had to be immediately operated on.
  • The survivor was referred to a government hospital in Vadodara.
  • The accused raped the girl and inserted an iron rod in her private parts.
  • The police found that the accused had raped the girl last month as well.
Superintendent of Police, Mayur Chawda, said, the man, Vijay Paswan, raped her and inserted an iron rod in her private parts, adding that during their preliminary investigation, they found that the accused raped the girl last month as well.

Conclusion: The police have filed charges under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The incident highlights the urgency of addressing sexual violence against children and the need for stringent measures to protect them.
newTitle: Man Arrested for Raping and Injuring 10-Year-Old Girl in Gujarat: Police

title: Influencer Throws Notes On Highway For 'Money Hunt' Challenge, Arrested In Hyderabad - NDTV
summary:
Influencer Arrests for Money Hunt Challenge in Hyderabad

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: NDTV

An Instagram influencer has been arrested in Hyderabad after a video he posted showing him throwing bundles of currency notes along the Outer Ring Road (ORR) went viral, leading to public chaos and safety concerns.

  • The individual, known as Bhanuchander alias Anchor Chandu, initiated a 'Money Hunt' challenge.
  • In the video, he claimed to have tossed ₹20,000 in cash near ORR exit number 9, causing people to stop their cars and search for the money.
  • The act led to traffic disruption and prompted police action for public safety.
  • Authorities have registered a case against him for endangering public safety.
“Social media should be a platform to inspire and educate, not to act irresponsibly,” said Rachakonda Police Commissioner G. Sudheer Babu.

The incident highlights the potential dangers of irresponsible social media challenges and the need for responsible content creation.
newTitle: Influencer Arrested for Dangerous 'Money Hunt' Challenge in Hyderabad

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 19 LIVE Updates: Priyanka Gandhi, Anurag Thakur in 21-member Joint Parliamentary Committee on ‘One Nation One Election’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 19 LIVE Updates: Joint Parliamentary Committee Formed for ‘One Nation One Election’

Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

The government has formed a Joint Parliamentary Committee to review the ‘One Nation, One Election Bills’. The Congress party has criticized the bill's introduction, demanding its withdrawal.

  • Members from Congress: Priyanka Gandhi, Manish Tewari.
  • Members from BJP: Bansuri Swaraj, Anurag Thakur.
  • The motion to introduce the bill was approved after a vote in the Lok Sabha.
  • Amit Shah faced criticism for his remarks on BR Ambedkar.
  • The Constitution debate in Rajya Sabha concluded with attacks on the Congress party's history and amendments.
“Ye fashion hogaya hai, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar, Ambedkar… Itna naam agar bhagwan ka lete toh saat janmo tak swarg mil jata.” - Amit Shah

The proceedings in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha were adjourned amid disruptions related to Amit Shah’s statements on Dr B R Ambedkar.

The Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) set to review the 'One Nation One Election' bill will include prominent political figures such as Priyanka Gandhi and Anurag Thakur. The committee is expected to delve into the potential impacts of implementing simultaneous elections across the nation.

title: India, China Arrive At 6 Consensus Points As Ajit Doval, Wang Yi Meet - NDTV
Ajit Doval, Wang Yi discuss measures for peace at LAC, amicable India-China ties - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajit Doval and Wang Yi Discuss Peace Measures for India-China Relations

Publication Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The meeting between Indian NSA Ajit Doval and his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi marks the first significant dialogue since tensions escalated between the two countries in 2020. They discussed measures for maintaining peace at the Line of Actual Control (LAC) and improving bilateral relations.

  • The leaders emphasized a political perspective for the bilateral relationship.
  • They affirmed the implementation of disengagement measures in Demchok and Depsang.
  • Both defined the importance of ensuring peaceful conditions along the border.
  • Doval invited Wang to visit India for future discussions.
“Drawing on the learnings from the events of 2020, they discussed various measures to maintain peace and tranquillity on the border and advance effective border management.”

The discussions highlighted the commitment to stable and amicable relations between India and China as vital for regional peace and prosperity.
newTitle: Ajit Doval and Wang Yi Discuss Peace Measures for India-China Relations

title: Ambedkar remarks: Shah should either step down or PM should sack him, says Congress chief - The Hindu
summary:
Congress Demands Amit Shah's Resignation Over Ambedkar Remarks

Published: December 18, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge has called for the resignation of Home Minister Amit Shah following controversial remarks made regarding B.R. Ambedkar.

  • Kharge stated that PM Modi should remove Shah if he does not resign.
  • The Congress party has intensified protests against Shah’s comments with demonstrations nationwide.
  • Shah's remarks were perceived as disrespectful towards the architect of the Constitution, leading to widespread condemnation.
  • Other political leaders, including Mamata Banerjee and M.K. Stalin, criticized Shah’s comments, labeling them casteist and anti-Dalit.
  • Kharge demanded Shah apologize to the nation for what he termed an insult.
“If there is no resignation, there will be protests all over the country.” – Mallikarjun Kharge

The backlash continues to grow as political leaders unite against perceived disrespect for Ambedkar, with increasing calls for accountability within the government.
newTitle: Congress Demands Amit Shah's Resignation Over Ambedkar Remarks

title: Mumbai boat accident: Video shows speedboat ramming Elephanta Cave ferry - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mumbai Boat Accident: Video Shows Speedboat Ramming Elephanta Cave Ferry

Date: Dec 18, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic ferry accident occurred in Mumbai where a speedboat collided with the Neelkamal ferry, resulting in multiple casualties and extensive rescue operations by the Indian Coast Guard.

  • Two passengers confirmed dead, with total fatalities rising to 13 as search operations continue.
  • More than 80 individuals rescued by the Indian Coast Guard and Navy personnel.
  • The incident occurred when an Indian Navy craft lost control during engine trials.
  • The Neelkamal ferry was transporting 85 passengers to the Elephanta Caves.
  • Extensive search and rescue efforts involve multiple Navy and Coast Guard vessels, as well as helicopters.
  • Local authorities and fishermen assisted in rescue operations.
“Deeply saddened by the loss of precious lives in the collision... Extensive search & rescue efforts are ongoing.” - Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

The tragedy highlights the importance of maritime safety regulations and the swift response of rescue teams in emergencies.
newTitle: Mumbai Boat Accident: Speedboat Collides with Ferry, Leaving 13 Dead

title: Mansarovar Yatra, Border Issues Among 6 Consensus Points Agreed During India-China Talks - News18
summary:
India and China Reach Key Agreement on Border Issues and Mansarovar Yatra

Publication Date: December 19, 2024 Source: News18

After five years, a significant dialogue took place between India and China, resulting in six agreed points aimed at resolving ongoing border disputes and resuming the pilgrimage to Mansarovar.

  • The two nations agreed to strengthen cross-border exchanges and cooperation.
  • Focus on promoting the resumption of Indian pilgrims to Tibet.
  • Maintain peace in border areas and ensure stable bilateral relations.
  • Enhance cross-border tourism and river cooperation.
  • Plan for further talks in India next year.
  • Continue diplomatic and military negotiations to resolve border issues.
“The border issue should be handled from the overall situation of bilateral relations.”

This meeting marks a hopeful development in India-China relations, emphasizing the importance of cooperation for regional peace.

The Congress party has strongly criticized Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his comments regarding Dr. BR Ambedkar, demanding an apology amid ongoing tensions in Parliament.

  • The Winter Session of Parliament is nearing its end, concluding on December 20, with multiple bills on the agenda.
  • Amit Shah accused Congress of distorting facts and misrepresenting his comments on Ambedkar during recent debates.
  • Shah emphasized that he had praised Ambedkar's contributions while alleging that the Congress party has historically insulted him.

title: Ferry capsizes off Mumbai near Gateway of India; two dead, 77 passengers rescued - The Hindu
summary:
Mumbai Ferry Capsizes Near Gateway of India, 13 Confirmed Dead

Published on: December 18, 2024 | Source: Press Trust of India

A tragic incident occurred when a private ferry capsized off the coast of Mumbai, resulting in the death of 13 individuals, including Naval personnel. Rescue operations are ongoing for other missing passengers.

  • Thirteen casualties reported, with several critically injured.
  • The accident occurred when the ferry, Neelkamal, collided with a Navy craft during engine trials.
  • Over 110 passengers were on board; most have been rescued and taken to hospitals.
  • Indian Navy and Coast Guard are conducting joint operations to recover those missing.
  • Chief Minister confirmed that search efforts are focused on locating seven to eight missing passengers.
“A Navy craft undergoing engine trials lost control and collided with a passenger ferry Neel Kamal off Karanja, Mumbai.” - Indian Navy Official

The situation remains critical as emergency services continue to look for any remaining survivors and assess the full extent of this tragic event.

Union Home Minister Amit Shah accused the Congress party of twisting his remarks regarding B.R. Ambedkar, claiming they misrepresent his views on the Constitution. He proposed exploring legal actions against the party for these distortions.

title: Arvind Kejriwal announces new health scheme for Delhi's elderly population - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Introduces Health Scheme for Elderly in Delhi Ahead of Elections

Date: Dec 18, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), announced a new health scheme called 'Sanjeevani Yojana' for elderly citizens in Delhi, promising free treatment in government and private hospitals.

  • The scheme is aimed at citizens over 60 years old.
  • There will be no upper limit on the cost of treatment.
  • Registration will begin shortly with AAP workers assisting at home.
  • The scheme will be implemented once AAP wins the upcoming elections.
“There are a lot of errors in the central government's scheme and Delhi government has launched a better scheme correcting those errors,” said Delhi Minister Saurabh Bhardwaj.

This announcement follows a face-off with the BJP regarding the implementation of the Central government's Aayushmaan Bharat scheme.

In conclusion, this move is part of AAP's strategy to capitalize on healthcare issues ahead of elections, promising enhanced support for seniors.
newTitle: Kejriwal Introduces Health Scheme for Elderly in Delhi Ahead of Elections

title: Assam Congress leader dies after police action on protesters - The Hindu
summary:
Assam Congress Leader Dies Following Police Action on Protesters

Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

An Assam Congress leader, Mridul Islam, died after police fired tear gas shells at protesters during a demonstration against government policies in Guwahati.

  • Mridul Islam, a resident of Boko and secretary of the Assam Pradesh Congress Committee’s legal cell, collapsed following police action.
  • He died at the Gauhati Medical College and Hospital after the incident.
  • The protest was part of a party demonstration against the installation of smart meters and the central government’s refusal to discuss significant political issues.
  • State Congress president Bhupen Kumar Borah stated Islam's death was a result of police brutality, labeling him a martyr.
  • The party has called for police accountability and compensation for his family.
  • Hundreds of Congress members protested against the BJP near the Raj Bhavan, where police intervened with tear gas.
  • The Guwahati Press Club condemned police actions against journalists during the protests.
“Mridul Islam did not die. The Himanta Biswa Sarma government murdered him through a planned crackdown on peaceful protestors.” - Bhupen Kumar Borah

The incident highlights ongoing tensions between political groups and law enforcement in Assam, raising concerns about police conduct during public demonstrations.
newTitle: Assam Congress Leader Dies Following Police Action on Protesters

title: Mumbai Boat Accident: Boat Carrying Over 30 People Overturns Near Gateway of India (Watch Video) - Lokmat Times
summary:
Mumbai Boat Accident: Boat Carrying Over 30 People Overturns Near Gateway of India

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: Lokmat Times

A boat carrying passengers from the Gateway of India in Mumbai to the Elephanta Caves capsized near the gateway. Preliminary reports indicate that the ferry Neelkamal, en route to Elephanta, has sunk with approximately 30 to 35 passengers on board. Nearby boats quickly responded to assist in rescuing passengers. Currently, there is no information regarding the cause of the incident.

  • The incident occurred around 4 pm on Wednesday.
  • Rescue efforts are being coordinated by the Navy, Coast Guard, and Marine Police.
  • 11 Navy boats, 3 Marine Police boats, and 1 Coast Guard boat are in the area.
  • 4 helicopters are conducting Search and Rescue operations.
  • No casualties have been reported as of now.
— Lokmat Times (@lokmattimeseng) December 18, 2024

The incident highlights safety concerns regarding ferry services in the area, as public ferries are commonly used to transport visitors to the Elephanta Caves.
newTitle: Mumbai Boat Accident: Boat Carrying Over 30 People Overturns Near Gateway of India

Date: Recent

Activists and villagers in Abujhmad allege that seven individuals killed by police were not Maoists but local villagers, with four children injured during the incident.

  • Activists claim that five of the seven killed were villagers working in fields.
  • Four children sustained serious injuries and reportedly did not receive medical help for three days.
  • Police deny the claims, stating that the children were used as human shields by Maoists.
  • The incident occurred in the villages of Kummam and Lekawada under Rekhawaya Panchayat, Narayanpur district.
  • Human rights activists express concern over the ongoing incidents affecting tribal children in the region.
“The deaths and injuries of tribal children in this ongoing campaign by security forces in Bastar should alarm the nation.” - Rinchin, Human Rights Activist

The incident has raised serious concerns over police conduct and the safety of villagers in the ongoing conflict with Maoists.

title: Starlink Device Found In Manipur Not Working, Incompatible: Forensics - NDTV
summary:
Starlink Device Found In Manipur Not Working, Incompatible: Forensics

Date: December 23, 2023 Source: NDTV

Manipur authorities have reported that a Starlink dish and router recovered from insurgents are non-functional and incompatible in the state.

  • The devices were retrieved by security forces during an operation in Imphal East.
  • Starlink is currently not available in India and has not been licensed to operate there.
  • The situation has raised concerns about the implications of satellite-based internet technology in conflict areas.
  • Starlink's parent company, SpaceX, has faced regulatory challenges in the country since 2021.
  • The region has experienced ongoing ethnic violence, leading to increased security and communication concerns.
“Starlink satellite beams are turned off over India and were never on in the first place.” - Elon Musk

The discovery of the Starlink device amidst ongoing violence in Manipur has fueled concerns about potential external influences on local conflicts.
newTitle: Starlink Device Found In Manipur Not Working, Incompatible: Forensics
